content.new:
Hi all,

I’m not sure if this is actually a bug or if it’s just my inexperience with CMake.

My project directory structure:

```
|- Project/
    |- GUIBugDemo.world
    |- CMakeLists.txt
    |- GUIBugPlugin.cc
    |- include/
        |- GUIBugPlugin.hh
```

Each of the files are just the bare minimum boilerplate \(see attached\).

When I try to run the world I get the following error:

```
[Err] [Plugin.hh:178] Failed to load plugin ./libGUIBugPlugin.so: ./libGUIBugPlugin.so: undefined symbol: _ZTVN6gazebo12GUIBugPluginE
[Err] [MainWindow.cc:2092] Unable to create gui overlay plugin with filename[./libGUIBugPlugin.so]
```

This problem went away when I moved the header file out of `~/Project/include/` and just into `~/Project/`,

and changed `#include “include/GUIBugPlugin.hh”` to `#include “GUIBugPlugin.hh”`

I did not have this problem with non-GUI plugins. I am running Ubuntu 18.04 and this is Gazebo 9.

Did I simply miss something in CMake? I already tried adding `~/Project/include/` to `include_directories` in `CMakeLists.txt`

Hi all,

I’m not sure if this is actually a bug or if it’s just my inexperience with CMake.

My project directory structure:

```
|- Project/
    |- GUIBugDemo.world
    |- CMakeLists.txt
    |- GUIBugPlugin.cc
    |- include/
        |- GUIBugPlugin.hh
```

 Each of the files are just the bare minimum boilerplate \(see attached\).

When I try to run the world I get the following error:

```
[Err] [Plugin.hh:178] Failed to load plugin ./libGUIBugPlugin.so: ./libGUIBugPlugin.so: undefined symbol: _ZTVN6gazebo12GUIBugPluginE
[Err] [MainWindow.cc:2092] Unable to create gui overlay plugin with filename[./libGUIBugPlugin.so]
```

This problem went away when I moved the header file out of `~/Project/include/` and just into `~/Project/`, 

and changed `#include “include/GUIBugPlugin.hh”` to `#include “GUIBugPlugin.hh”`

I did not have this problem with non-GUI plugins. I am running Ubuntu 18.04 and this is Gazebo 9.

issue.title: GUI Plugins Fail to Load if Header File is in Sub-Directory
GUI Plugins Fail to Load if Header File is in Sub-Directory
